raw.name: JAWS
raw.defaultConfigurationInstructionsHTML: Configure JAWS with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.

instructions: Press <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> to determine which cursor is active.
If the PC cursor is active, press <kbd>Escape</kbd> to activate the virtual cursor.
Press <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> to determine which cursor is active.
If the virtual cursor is active, press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>z</kbd> to disable the virtual cursor.
Ensure you are in JAWS mode. Press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>j</kbd> if you are unsure.
Press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Page Up</kbd> to increase the speech rate.
Ensure you are in JAWS mode. Press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>j</kbd> if you are unsure.
Use the arrow keys to select 'Speech & Sounds' from the categories list.
Find and choose the option related to comment announcements. This might be listed under 'Speech Settings' or a similar category.
Look for a checkbox or toggle to enable comment announcements and check or activate it.
Press <kbd>Enter</kbd> to confirm and exit the Settings Center.

setupScript.scriptDescription: sets focus on the 'Trigger Alert' button
setupScript.name: setFocusOnButton
setupScript.source:
// sets focus on the 'Trigger Alert' button
testPageDocument.querySelector('#alert-trigger').focus();

instructions.instructions: Starting at the 'Trigger Alert' button, activate the button to trigger the alert.

virtualCursor: Configure JAWS with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.
Press <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> to determine which cursor is active.
If the PC cursor is active, press <kbd>Escape</kbd> to activate the virtual cursor.
speechRateIncrease: Configure JAWS with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.
Ensure you are in JAWS mode. Press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>j</kbd> if you are unsure.
Press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Page Up</kbd> to increase the speech rate.
commentAnnouncementOn: Configure JAWS with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.
Ensure you are in JAWS mode. Press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>j</kbd> if you are unsure.
Use the arrow keys to select 'Speech & Sounds' from the categories list.
Find and choose the option related to comment announcements. This might be listed under 'Speech Settings' or a similar category.
Look for a checkbox or toggle to enable comment announcements and check or activate it.
Press <kbd>Enter</kbd> to confirm and exit the Settings Center.
pcCursor: Configure JAWS with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.
Press <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> to determine which cursor is active.
If the virtual cursor is active, press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>z</kbd> to disable the virtual cursor.
